net.fec.openrq

Class ArrayDataDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fec.openrq.ArrayDataDecoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataDecoder

    public final class ArrayDataDecoder
extends Object
implements DataDecoder
    A RaptorQ decoder for an array data object.

      • isDataDecoded

        public boolean isDataDecoded()
        Description copied from interface: DataDecoder
        Returns true if, and only if, the original data is fully decoded. The original data is considered fully decoded when every source block is fully decoded.
        Specified by:
        isDataDecoded in interface DataDecoder
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, the original data is fully decoded

      • sourceBlock

        public SourceBlockDecoder sourceBlock(int sbn)
        Returns a decoder object for the source block with the provided source block number.

        Bounds checking - If we have Z as the number of source blocks into which is divided the the source data being decoded, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • sbn ≥ 0
        • sbn < Z
        Specified by:
        sourceBlock in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        sbn - A source block number
        Returns:
        a decoder object for a specific source block
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided source block number is invalid
        See Also:
        DataDecoder.numberOfSourceBlocks()

      • sourceBlockIterable

        public Iterable<? extends SourceBlockDecoder> sourceBlockIterable()
        Description copied from interface: DataDecoder
        Returns a new iterable over all source block decoders. The resulting iterable can be iterated using a "foreach" loop.
        Specified by:
        sourceBlockIterable in interface DataDecoder
        Returns:
        a new iterable over all source block decoders

      • dataArray

        public byte[] dataArray()
        Returns an array of bytes containing the source data. Use method isDataDecoded() to check if the data is complete.
        Returns:
        an array of bytes containing the source data
        See Also:
        isDataDecoded()

      • parsePacket

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 byte[] symbols,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given source block number, encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol, and symbols data.

        The symbols data will be read, in the array, from position 0 inclusive to position symbols.length exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Specified by:
        parsePacket in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - An array of bytes containing the symbols data
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If symbols is null

      • parsePacket

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 byte[] symbols,
                                 int off,
                                 int len,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given source block number, encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol, and symbols data.

        The symbols data will be read, in the array, from position off inclusive to position (off + len) exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Specified by:
        parsePacket in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - An array of bytes containing the symbols data
        off - The starting index in the array (must be non-negative)
        len - The length of the symbols data (must be non-negative and no larger than symbols.length - off)
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the pre-conditions on the array offset and length do not hold
        NullPointerException - If symbols is null

      • parsePacket

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 ByteBuffer symbols,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given source block number, encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol, and symbols data.

        The symbols data will be read, in the buffer, from the current position inclusive to the current limit exclusive. If the parsing succeeds, the position of the buffer will have been advanced to the limit.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Specified by:
        parsePacket in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - A buffer containing the symbols data
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a duplicate of the buffer
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If symbols is null

      • parsePacket

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(SerializablePacket ser,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given serializable packet.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Specified by:
        parsePacket in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        ser - A serializable packet
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array inside the serializable packet
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If ser is null

      • parsePacket

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(byte[] array,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given array. The packet bytes in the array must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.asArray().

        The encoding packet will be read, in the array, from position 0 inclusive to position array.length exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Specified by:
        parsePacket in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        array - An array of bytes containing an encoding packet
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If array is null

      • parsePacket

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(byte[] array,
                                 int off,
                                 int len,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given array. The packet bytes in the array must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.asArray().

        The encoding packet will be read, in the array, from position off inclusive to position (off + len) exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Specified by:
        parsePacket in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        array - An array of bytes containing an encoding packet
        off - The starting index in the array (must be non-negative)
        len - The length of the encoding packet (must be non-negative and no larger than array.length - off)
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the pre-conditions on the array offset and length do not hold
        NullPointerException - If array is null

      • parsePacket

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(ByteBuffer buffer,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Parses an encoding packet from the given buffer. The packet bytes in the buffer must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.asBuffer().

        The encoding packet will be read, in the buffer, from the current position inclusive to the current limit exclusive. If the parsing succeeds, the position of the buffer will have been advanced by the number of bytes read.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Specified by:
        parsePacket in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer containing an encoding packet
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a duplicate of the buffer
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If buffer is null

      • readPacketFrom

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> readPacketFrom(DataInput in)
                                      throws IOException
        Reads and parses an encoding packet from a DataInput object. The read packet bytes must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.writeTo(java.io.DataOutput).

        Examples of DataInput objects are DataInputStream and ObjectInputStream.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until a whole packet is read from the input, or a parsing failure is detected, or an IOException is throw.

        Specified by:
        readPacketFrom in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        in - A DataInput object from which an encoding packet is read
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurs while reading from the DataInput object
        NullPointerException - If in is null

      • readPacketFrom

        public Parsed<EncodingPacket> readPacketFrom(ReadableByteChannel ch)
                                      throws IOException
        Reads and parses an encoding packet from a ReadableByteChannel object. The read packet bytes must follow the format specified by EncodingPacket.writeTo(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel).

        Examples of ReadableByteChannel objects are SocketChannel and FileChannel.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the encoding packet can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until a whole packet is read from the channel, or a parsing failure is detected, or an IOException is throw.

        Specified by:
        readPacketFrom in interface DataDecoder
        Parameters:
        ch - A ReadableByteChannel object from which an encoding packet is read
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurs while reading from the ReadableByteChannel object
        NullPointerException - If ch is null
